label: 殿上之間
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Perhaps the busiest of [Seiryōden's] rooms, where kugyō and tenjōbito met to shine in the reflected glory of the Imperial presence.  The apartment's sparse furnishings consisted chiefly of the Imperial Chair (goishi), the courtiers' duty-board (nikkyū no fuda), and some lacquered dining tables and other objects.  Its most celebrated appurtenance was the Partition of the Annual Ceremonies (Nenjū Gyōji no Sōji) (p. 843). [清涼殿、公卿、殿上人、御椅子、日給簡、年中行事障子]
